channel.title: RS2 Client Development
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm here to propose a solution to a problem the forums have. Nobody can get legitimate help from the 'Client Help' section of the forums because it is constantly being flooded with Webclient questions. I've asked multiple questions in the 'Client Help' section and [b]never[/b] get an answer. So, I'm almost forced to post in the wrong section. I noticed there was a topic specifically for custom items and models, so could we get a topic just for webclients? Or could we possibly get a new section added to the forums that are just for webclients? Just about anything of the sort would really help a lot of people that are having Client problems.
Please post if you guys are in support of this or not!

item.title: RS2 Client Development
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:32, topic:432600”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,535370.0.html

RiiPiiNFtW has taken it upon himself to make the tutorial, although it has yet to be completed. I think his structure is fine, does anybody else have disagree/think it should be done differently?[/quote]just use his, I tire of helping people with 508 map errors anyway

Read full topic

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:30, topic:432600”]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,490803.0.html

It may be a jarring tutorial but I also tell what is needed for a webclient. I could always add in a cachedownloader class or something.[/quote]
What you have is great, if you were to just add a few steps on the end that were specifically to turn that jar into the web client applet then it would be perfect.

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:8, topic:432600”]Does appear to be a little crowded of webclient topics there, maybe someone just needs to write a super duper noob friendly tutorial which works for all sources?
I doubt you’ll be able to persuade Mitb to add a board just for webclients, he’s very stingy on his board limit.

Anyway, what was your question? See if we can get it answered here. :)[/quote]my jarring tutorial is pretty user friendly :o (i include the basics of webclient making )
